avalancheActivity.comment:
The wind slabs can be released even by a single winter sport participant in particular on steep shady slopes above approximately 1800 m. In particular on steep slopes and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain small and medium-sized slab avalanches are possible. At elevated altitudes the avalanche prone locations are more widespread.
Several small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized moist avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs represent the main danger. Warming.

snowpackStructure.comment: The surface of the snowpack will soften during the day. As a consequence of new snow and wind from northerly directions, sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed. Snow depths vary greatly above the tree line, depending on the infuence of the wind. In particular at low and intermediate altitudes hardly any snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment: The older wind slabs are easy to recognise and unlikely to be released now.
avalancheActivity.highlights: From a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

snowpackStructure.comment: The surface of the snowpack will soften during the day. The snowpack will be subject to considerable local variations. Hardly any snow is lying above approximately 1600 m.
